tag.name: cfldap
tag.help: Provides an interface to a Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) directory server, such as the Netscape Directory Server.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of LDAP server.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port of the LDAP server (default 389).

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: The User ID. Required if secure = "CFSSL_BASIC"

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password that corresponds to user name. If secure = "CFSSL_BASIC", V2 encrypts the password before transmission.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: * query: returns LDAP entry information only. Requires name, start, and attributes attributes. * add: adds LDAP entries to LDAP server. Requires attributes attribute. * modify: modifies LDAP entries, except distinguished name dn attribute, on LDAP server. Requires dn. See modifyType attribute. * modifyDN: modifies distinguished name attribute for LDAP entries on LDAP server. Requires dn. * delete: deletes LDAP entries on an LDAP server. Requires dn.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Required if action = "Query" Name of LDAP query. The tag validates the value.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum length of time, in seconds, to wait for LDAP processing. Default 60000

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of entries for LDAP queries.

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: Required if action = "Query" Distinguished name of entry to be used to start a search.

parameter.name: scope
parameter.help: Scope of search, from entry specified in start attribute for action = "Query". * oneLevel: entries one level below entry. * base: only the entry. * subtree: entry and all levels below it.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.help:
Required if action = "Query", "Add", "ModifyDN", or "Modify" For queries: comma-delimited list of attributes to return. For queries, to get all attributes, specify "*".
If action = "add" or "modify", you can specify a list of update columns. Separate attributes with a semicolon.
If action = "ModifyDN", CFML passes attributes to the LDAP server without syntax checking.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: Search criteria for action = "Query". List attributes in the form: "(attribute operator value)" Example: "(sn = Smith)"

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Attribute(s) by which to sort query results. Use a comma delimiter.

parameter.name: sortcontrol
parameter.help:
Default asc * nocase: case-insensitive sort * asc: ascending (a to z) case-sensitive sort * desc: descending (z to a) case-sensitive sort
You can enter a combination of sort types; for example, sortControl = "nocase, asc".

parameter.name: dn
parameter.help: Distinguished name, for update action. Example: "cn = Bob Jensen, o = Ace Industry, c = US"

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Used with action = "query". First row of LDAP query to insert into a CFML query.

parameter.name: modifytype
parameter.help:
Default replace
How to process an attribute in a multi-value list. * add: appends it to any attributes * delete: deletes it from the set of attributes * replace: replaces it with specified attributes
You cannot add an attribute that is already present or that is empty.

parameter.name: rebind
parameter.help: * Yes: attempt to rebind referral callback and reissue query by referred address using original credentials. * No: referred connections are anonymous

parameter.name: referral
parameter.help: Number of hops allowed in a referral. A value of 0 disables referred addresses for LDAP; no data is returned.

parameter.name: secure
parameter.help:
Security to employ, and required information. One option: * CFSSL_BASIC
"CFSSL_BASIC" provides V2 SSL encryption and server authentication.

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help:
Default , (a comma) Delimiter to separate attribute values of multi-value attributes. Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.
For example, if $ (dollar sign), the attributes attribute could be "objectclass = top$person", where the first value of objectclass is top, and the second value is person. This avoids confusion if values include commas.

parameter.name: delimiter
parameter.help:
Separator between attribute name-value pairs. Use this attribute if:
* the attributes attribute specifies more than one item, or * an attribute contains the default delimiter (semicolon). For example: mgrpmsgrejecttext;lang-en
Used by query, add, and modify actions, and by cfldap to output multi-value attributes.
For example, if $ (dollar sign), you could specify "cn = Double Tree Inn$street = 1111 Elm; Suite 100 where the semicolon is part of the street value.
